name: Macedonia
declaringWar: You are in my way, you must be destroyed.
attacked: As a matter of fact I too grow weary of peace.
defeated: You have somehow become my undoing! What kind of beast are you?
introduction: Hello stranger! I am Alexandros, son of kings and grandson of the gods!
tradeRequest: My friend, does this seem reasonable to you?
uniqueName: We need to take India right fucking now
uniques: [+2] Movement <in [Enemy Land] tiles> <for [Land] units>
[+1 Culture] per [2] population [in annexed cities]
[+2 Culture] per [2] population [in annexed cities] <during a Golden Age>
uniqueText:
+2 Movement for all land units in enemy territory. 
+1 [Culture] for every 2 population in annexed cities, doubled during Golden Ages.

name: Athens
defeated:
Beautiful Athens... you've plunged humanity into a dark age... 
Bad End.
introduction: I greet you on behalf of Athens as her elected representive; behold, the bastion of enlightenment and mother city of the Ionian Greeks.
hateHello: Come to give up your throne, tyrant?
tradeRequest: Trust us, this agreement will benefit all of us the most, I'm sure I don't have to bore you with the specifics.
uniques: Cannot build [Settler] units
[-50]% City-State Influence degradation
City-State Influence recovers at twice the normal rate
Militaristic City-States grant units [2] times as fast when you are at war with a common nation
[+2 Science, +3 Culture] per [2] social policies adopted
[+1 Culture] from all [Science] buildings
Can spend Gold to annex or puppet a City-State that has been your ally for [15] turns <after adopting [Meritocracy]>
uniqueText:
City state influence recovers at twice the speed and degrades half as fast. 
+3 [Science] and +3 [Culture] for every other social policy adopted. 
+1 [Culture] from all [Science] buildings. 
Can annex allied CS with [Gold] after 15 turns of alliance have passed and Representation is adopted (TBR). 
Cannot build settlers.
spyNames: Dada da du du da do do mo ne bam ba bah

name: Sparta
declaringWar:
Laconia's fields require fresh helots, and her markets healthy slaves! 
The weak should fear the strong; now natural order will be enforced.
attacked: Sparta shall never submit to foreign cravens! Apollo smiles upon us, barbarian. You will not be walking away from this one.
defeated: No... our society was infallible, indestructable... at least we will die with it like true Spartans.
hateHello:
I would have settled our differences on the fields of battle, were we not currently preoccupied declaring war on our peasant class. 
What you may call madness, we call Sparda.
tradeRequest:
This is our offer. 
We shall await your reply by the edge of a comically large hole.
uniques: Cannot build [Settler] units
Free [Warrior] appears <upon constructing [Production] [in capital]> <with [33]% chance> <before the [Classical era]>
Free [Elite Hoplites] appears <upon constructing [Production] [in capital]> <with [33]% chance> <starting from the [Classical era]> <before the [Medieval era]>

Free [Infantry] appears <upon constructing [Production] [in capital]> <with [33]% chance> <starting from the [Modern era]>

All newly-trained [Sword] units [in capital] receive the [Agoge] promotion
[+50]% Production when constructing [Military] units [in capital]
uniqueText:
+50% [Production] of military units in the capital. 
Gain 1 population in the capital and a worker upon conquering a city. Get a free infantry unit when declaring war, and occasionally when complete production buildings in the capital. 
All Melee units receive the Agoge Promotion 
Cannot build settlers.
spyNames: The Rolling Corpse of Ayn Rand

name: Thebes
declaringWar: I think it's best we deal with you now, lest you become a bigger issue.
defeated:
I leave behind no sons, and I do not fear death. But even the most blessed of men are one day doomed to watch their mothers die before them. 
As Thebes burns before me I must ask, what blessing are my own victories if they could not preseve her legacy?.
introduction: Greetings. I have been appointed to speak for Thebes, Boeotia, and all its people. May our relationship be a prosperous one.
neutralHello: Something you wish to tell me?
hateHello:
You shouldn't let old slights distract you from our mutual intrests. 
Nothing washes away bad blood like Boeotian wine.
tradeRequest: I think this arrangement is in both our interests, eh?
uniques: Cannot build [Settler] units
Allied City-States provide [Culture] equal to [+25]% of what they produce for themselves <when not at war>
Allied City-States provide [Gold] equal to [+25]% of what they produce for themselves <when not at war>
Allied City-States provide [Production] equal to [50]% of what they produce for themselves <when at war>
Militaristic City-States grant units [5] times as fast when you are at war with a common nation
Gain [60] Influence with a [Great General] gift to a City-State
[Great General] is earned [20]% faster
Can spend Gold to annex or puppet a City-State that has been your ally for [10] turns. <after adopting [Patronage]>
[+2 Faith] per [3] social policies adopted
uniqueText:
City state allies grant 1/4th of their [Gold] and [Culture] output when at peace, and half their [Production] output when at war.
 Great Generals automatically start at 3 turn Golden Age upon spawning, are earned at twice the rate and earn 60 influence when gifted. 
Can annex allied CS with [Gold] after 10 turns of alliance have passed and Patronage is adopted (TBR). Every third policy adopted yields +2 [Faith] per turn.
Cannot build settlers.

name: Corinth
declaringWar: We warned you. We made this colony and we can unmake it too.
attacked:
Oh shit oh fuckj 
- SPARTAAAA! 
HEEELP!
defeated: Oh, our beautiful polis, ohh, woe is Corinth. You'll at least finish my canal project, won't you?
uniques: [+1 Culture] from all [All] buildings
[+1 Happiness, +1 Gold] from all [All] buildings <during a Golden Age>
[+40]% Production when constructing [Naval] units [in capital]

name: Syracuse
declaringWar: It's time you exited the picture.
defeated:
The sword of Damocles finally falls... To be honest, I never thought I'd see the day. 
May your reign be short, and your death slow.
neutralHello: Do you also appreciate the higher pleasures in life?
tradeRequest: Trust us, this agreement will benefit all of us the most, I'm sure I don't have to bore you with the specifics.
uniques: Cannot annex cities
[+1 Culture] from every [Scientist]
[+2 Science] from every [Engineer]
Gain a free [Architectural Marvel] [in a random city] <upon gaining a [Great Engineer] unit>
spyNames: Dada da du du da do do mo ne bam ba bah

name: Mycenae
declaringWar: What's yours is mine, and what's mine will become more.
attacked: Ugh, we'll see whay my wife has to say about this.
defeated: A day will come when sacred Troy shall perish, and Priam and his people shall be slain. Is this too, the fate of Mycenae?
introduction: Well met your grace. I am Agamemnon, and I am argoning.
hateHello: Where the FUCK is my wife?
tradeRequest:
Out of curiosity, would you want a huge wooden horse? 
No? 
Why not?
uniqueText: Defensive buildings give 12% [Production] towards Melee units, and are built 50% faster on cities on [Hill]. Sword and Melee gun units are 20% stronger on foreign continents. Gain Great Artists 25% faster during wars.
uniques: [+50]% Production when constructing [Walls] buildings [in all cities] <in [Hill] tiles>
[+12]% Production when constructing [Melee] units [in all cities] <in cities with a [Walls]>

civilopediaText.text: I'm not watching that new Odyssey movie unless Brad Pitt is dressed like an armored phallus

name: Minoa
attacked:
Hah, what, were you thinking of swimming over here? 

...

 I'm not actually in Krete right now, am I?
introduction: I am King Minos of Minoa, try not to track dirt over my palace.
hateHello: My son's getting real peckish right now.
